intro: Parabaena hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy parabaena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Parabaena hirsuta is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
